duck: aquifer definition: a water-bearing stratum of permeable rock, sand, or gravel.
Groundwater model - Groundwater models are computer models of groundwater flow systems, and are used by hydrogeologists.
Seasonal thermal energy storage - aquifers may be used for storing heat or cold between opposing seasons, for ecologically heating/cooling greenhouses, buildings large or small, and district systems.
Cistern - A cistern is a waterproof receptacle for holding liquids, usually water.
Aquifer storage and recovery - Aquifer Storage and Recovery (ASR) is the re-injection of potable water back into an aquifer for later recovery and use.
An aquifer is an underground layer of water-bearing permeable rock or unconsolidated materials (gravel, sand, or silt) from which groundwater can be extracted using a water well.
Overexploitation - Overexploitation, also called overharvesting, refers to harvesting a renewable resource to the point of diminishing returns.
Artesian aquifer - An artesian aquifer is a confined aquifer containing groundwater under positive pressure.

wiki.text:
An 'aquifer' is an underground layer of water-bearing permeable rock or
unconsolidated materials (gravel, sand, or silt) from which groundwater can be
extracted using a water well. The study of water flow in aquifers and the
characterization of aquifers is called hydrogeology. Related terms include
'aquitard', which is a bed of low permeability along an aquifer,<ref></ref> and
'aquiclude' (or aquifuge), which is a solid, impermeable area underlying or
overlying an aquifer. If the impermeable area overlies the aquifer pressure
could cause it to become a confined aquifer.
wiki.title: aquifer
